posts.title: python GIL
posts.text: CPython ä¸­çš„ GILï¼šå½±å“ä¸Žåº”å¯¹æ–¹æ³• Python å®˜æ–¹æ–‡æ¡£ global interpreter lock:The mechanism used by the CPython interpreter to assure that only one thread executes Python bytecode at a time. This simplifies the CPython implementation by making the object model (including critical built-in types such as dict) implicitly safe against concurrent access. Locking the entire interpreter makes it easier for the interpreter to be multi-threaded, at the expense of much of the parallelism afforded by multi-processor machines. However, some extension modules, either standard or third-party, are designed so as to release the GIL when doing computationally intensive tasks such as compression or hashing. Also, the GIL is always released when doing I/O. Past efforts to create a â€œfree-threadedâ€ interpreter (one which locks shared data at a much finer granularity) have not been successful because performance suffered in the common single-processor case. It is believed that overcoming this performance issue would make the implementation much more complicated and therefore costlier to maintain. å…¨å±€è§£é‡Šç¨‹åºé”ï¼šå…¨å±€è§£é‡Šç¨‹åºé”ï¼ˆGILï¼‰æ˜¯
